p: Influenza is a very important respiratory infectious disease that causes seasonal epidemics globally and annually among people of all age groups. Influenza not only causes seasonal epidemics but also causes pandemics every 10 to 40 years. Thus, influenza is considered as one of the most important among various infectious diseases [ 1]. Although vaccines and antiviral agents can be used in the control of influenza, so far, they have not yielded very satisfactory results [ 2 3]. Therefore, a well-organized surveillance system is necessary to monitor and respond effectively to influenza epidemics.
